member.name: MF_TOPOLOGY_TYPE
member.summary: Defines the type of a topology node.

member.name: MF_TOPOLOGY_TYPE.MF_TOPOLOGY_OUTPUT_NODE
member.summary: Output node. Represents a media sink in the topology.

member.name: MF_TOPOLOGY_TYPE.MF_TOPOLOGY_SOURCESTREAM_NODE
member.summary: Source node. Represents a media stream in the topology.

member.name: MF_TOPOLOGY_TYPE.MF_TOPOLOGY_TRANSFORM_NODE
member.summary: Transform node. Represents a Media Foundation Transform (MFT) in the topology.

member.name: MF_TOPOLOGY_TYPE.MF_TOPOLOGY_TEE_NODE
member.summary: Tee node. A tee node does not hold a pointer to an object. Instead, it represents a fork in the stream. A tee node has one input and multiple outputs, and samples from the upstream node are delivered to all of the downstream nodes.
